uk.ac.ed.csbe.sbsivisual.sbsiDataFormat
Class SBSIDataBuilder

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.ed.csbe.sbsivisual.sbsiDataFormat.SBSIDataBuilder

public class SBSIDataBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

Class for constructing SBSI data elements. Typical usage could be : 

 SBSIDataBuilder builder = new SBSIDataBuilder(numColumns);
 builder.setHeaders(myHeaders);
 builder.addDataRow(my row1);
 builder.getData();
getData() must not be called before setHeaders and addDatarow() have been called at least once.
This ensures a valid data object is retrieved each time.
Clients can check this by querying the isBuilt() method.

Author:
Richard Adams

Method Detail

setHeaders

public void setHeaders(java.lang.String[] headers)
Sets the column headers for this data object

Parameters:
headers - A non-null String [].
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if headers length != column count passed into constructor or if any header does not match the SBSIFormatRegexps4.COLUMN_NAME_PATTERN

setHeaderLocation

public void setHeaderLocation(java.lang.String location)
Sets the location of the header file

Parameters:
location - A non-null absolute or relative path to the header file.
A data object is valid without this being set.

addDataRow

public void addDataRow(java.lang.String[] dataToAdd)
Adds a row of data

Parameters:
dataToAdd - A non-null String[] of data to add
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if headers length != column count passed into constructor.

getData

public ISBSIData getData()
Retrieves the built data object.
To be called only if isBuilt() == true

Returns:
an ISBSIData element
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if isBuilt() == false

isBuilt

public boolean isBuilt()
Boolean test as to whether the data object has been fully assembled.

Returns:
true if setHeaders () and add dataRow is called at least once
